intro: Gagea nebrodensis, commonly known as the Nebroden gagea, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Liliaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe, particularly in Italy and Albania. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces delicate, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or forested habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
